definition: to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]

sentences.english: How again struggled hard, also not swim out this transparent boundaries.
sentences.chinese: 再怎么努力挣扎，也游不出这透明的界限。

sentences.english: We fought with them with grenade and sub-machine gun in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 在丛林中，我们用手榴弹和轻机枪挣扎着。

sentences.english: The lash bit into him again and again, but he neither whined nor struggled.
sentences.chinese: 鞭子一次次地打在他身上，而他既不哀叫也不挣扎。

sentences.english: In sum, few people remain at subsistence level.
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，很少人一直挣扎在温饱水平。

sentences.english: Struggling with urges to view leads to more viewing and more psychological problems.
sentences.chinese: 挣扎于看更多的的欲望和更多心理问题中。

sentences.english: My thought struggled at confessing, somehow hesitation ended in flinching.
sentences.chinese: 然妾心忏悔，百般挣扎，踌躇彷徨，畏葸不前。

sentences.english: It is a gift, a gift to the 22)throes of Mordor.
sentences.chinese: 这魔戒是送给垂死挣扎的魔朵的礼物。

sentences.english: With what thoughts was the unfortunate man contending?
sentences.chinese: 那倒霉的副主教在哪些念头里挣扎？

sentences.english: Already, around 1 billion people are living on the margins of survival.
sentences.chinese: 已有约十亿人在生死线上挣扎。

sentences.english: That may be too late for some publications struggling right now.
sentences.chinese: 对于现在已在挣扎中的一些出版公司可能太迟了。

sentences.english: Couldn't struggling prey simply brush off the poison as it trickles?
sentences.chinese: 难道在猎物挣扎的时候不能将流淌的毒液抹掉吗？

sentences.english: Still, some Americans are wrestling with the rightness and wrongness of the party-like responses.
sentences.chinese: 仍然有很多美国人在正确与错误中挣扎。

sentences.english: Goldworm continued to struggle and wave his arms, but with ever-diminishing style.
sentences.chinese: 戈德沃姆继续挣扎，并挥动着胳膊，但越来越无力。

sentences.english: The prone shadows with their outstretched arms clung to the feet of the hurrying light.
sentences.chinese: 竹影斑驳错落，挣扎著缠绕光阴匆忙的步履。

sentences.english: I struggle to set boundaries. I put myself last.
sentences.chinese: 我挣扎着去划清界限并把自己放在最后一位。

sentences.english: The airline industry, however, continues to struggle.
sentences.chinese: 然而航空业仍在继续挣扎着。

definition: to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
